title: AMTE Power takes its UK battery plant to the next level with the Thurso+ Project – AMTE Power
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in Thurso, Scotland, UK.

Capacity:
- The project aims to upscale AMTE Power’s electrochemical battery cell production facility in Thurso. The expected operational date for a significant new UK facility is 2022.

Investment amounts:
- N/A

Project progress:
- The project is currently in the phase of determining the feasibility of upscaling the electrochemical battery cell production facility in Thurso. It is also being submitted to Innovate UK’s competition for moving the UK automotive sector to zero emissions.

Project type:
- The project is focused on upscaling an existing battery production facility in Thurso, Scotland.

Value chain stages:
- The project aims to develop lean, flexible, and state-of-the-art high volume cell manufacturing capability, focusing on cell production and innovation in high-volume manufacturing techniques and processes within a small-scale facility.

title: Thurso: powering our growth plans – AMTE Power
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in Thurso, northeast Scotland, UK.

Capacity:
- The project is in the phase of production scale-up to commercial volumes, with a focus on ramping up production of two core cells: Ultra Prime and Ultra Safe. The specific capacity in GW is not provided.

Investment amounts:
- The exact capital invested or planned investment amounts are not specified in the provided information.

Project progress:
- The project is in the phase of investing further in the Thurso site to improve manufacturing capabilities for scaling up production of Ultra Prime and Ultra Safe cells. The site has been making cells for over 30 years and is now fulfilling orders and shipping prototypes.

Project type:
- The project is an expansion at an existing battery site, with a focus on improving manufacturing capabilities for scaling up production.

Value chain stages:
- The facility covers cell manufacturing and is focused on scaling up production of Ultra Prime and Ultra Safe cells, designed for industrial environments and energy storage applications.

Note: The information provided is specific to the AMTE Power facility in Thurso, UK.

title: Thurso battery maker to lead £5m electric vehicle project
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in Thurso, United Kingdom.

Capacity:
- No specific information about the planned capacity or current operational capacity is provided.

Investment amounts:
- The project has received £2.3 million in funding from the UK Government’s Advanced Propulsion Centre (APC) as part of the three-year, £5 million "Ultra" initiative.

Project progress:
- The project is part of the three-year, government-funded “Ultra” initiative aimed at enabling high volume manufacture of equipment for electric vehicles. The company, AMTE Power, will focus on bringing two lithium-ion batteries to “automotive readiness” during this initiative. The project involves collaboration with leading automotive manufacturers and supply chain companies.

Project type:
- The project is focused on bringing two lithium-ion batteries to “automotive readiness” and is part of a government-funded initiative, indicating that it involves development and preparation for high volume production rather than a new build or expansion.

Value chain stages:
- The article does not provide specific information about which value chain stages are covered at the facility.

Note: The article primarily focuses on the involvement of AMTE Power in the government-funded "Ultra" initiative and its collaboration with automotive manufacturers and supply chain companies. Specific details about the capacity, project type, and value chain stages are not explicitly mentioned.

title: AMTE reveals plan to extend its Thurso battery factory
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in Thurso, Caithness, in the United Kingdom.

Capacity:
- The article does not provide specific information about the planned or current operational capacity of the project.

Investment amounts:
- The article does not specify the exact amount of capital invested in the project. However, it mentions that AMTE Power raised £13.7m when it joined the AIM last March.

Project progress:
- AMTE Power has secured planning permission to extend its factory in Thurso. The company is also progressing plans for a new "gigafactory" in the UK, with Dundee being considered as a potential location.

Project type:
- The project involves the extension of an existing battery factory in Thurso and the potential construction of a new "gigafactory" in the UK.

Value chain stages:
- The article does not provide specific information about the value chain stages covered at the facility.

title: AMTE Power set to expand Thurso battery production plant
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Thurso, UK, with plans for three potential sites in the UK for a Gigafactory.

Capacity:
- The current turnover is £810,000, up 31% from the previous year, with a planned commercial production in 2025.

Investment amounts:
- The company has improved its balance sheet strength to £6.26m in cash or cash equivalents, up from £22,000. The UK Government has invested £130m into a high-rate cell production facility.

Project progress:
- AMTE Power has received planning permission to extend its Thurso production facility and is engaging with local authorities and design development for the Gigafactory site. The final decision on site selection is expected in 2022, with commercial production in 2025.

Project type:
- The project involves extending the existing Thurso production facility and establishing a new Gigafactory.

Value chain stages:
- The project covers cell manufacturing, with trials and scale-up testing ongoing at the UK Battery Industrialisation Centre. Additionally, a joint venture in Australia is set to license the Ultra Storage cell with initial targets of 200,000 cells per annum, scaling to 2GWh.

Note: The information provided is based on the available data and does not include any additional details beyond the specified sections.
